message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with the problem of item cold-start in collaborative filtering-based recommender systems. This problem is a well-known issue in information retrieval (IR) and machine learning (ML) domains, which are covered by the cs.IR and cs.LG sub-categories, respectively. The paper also proposes an optimization-based approach to solve the problem, which involves designing efficient algorithms to select a subset of users to rate the new item. This optimization problem falls under the scope of the cs.DS (data structures and algorithms) and cs.AI (artificial intelligence) sub-categories. Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed approach using the Netflix dataset, which is a common benchmark dataset for recommender systems, and thus, the paper could also be classified under the cs.SI (social and information networks) sub-category.
